Keywords: Horsemen , Police , X-Men
Real Name: Sean Cassidy
Special Powers
TARGETING: Elevated, Hindering, Destroy Blocking
IT'S GOING TO GET A LITTLE LOUD: Opposing characters within 6 squares and line of fire can't use Super Senses and can't reduce damage by more than 1.
SONIC SCREAM: Pulse Wave. When Banshee uses it, he deals his printed damage value instead of 1.

machineman
Thanks, sorta. It’s just, well a lotta times when I want to comment on why I see something really nice about a unit here in the units section, I hold back because I am unsure if it actually works like I’m thinking it would. I was pretty sure about the full printed damage and why, but not the fliers being carried because that’s new-ish. I just also like comments on units, since it’s part of the ‘realms and sometimes it’s an under-used area, imo. I see “rules questions in the rules forums” answers a lot. And I understand about what you’re saying about the formatting of posts here. But also, I think it’s fine to ask here as a yes or no, when a SP or trait seems to bend or ignore certain “rules”, and if there were anything further to be discussed, then, yep, take it up in the rules forum. But just to ask if something works the way a person is thinking it does or does not, just further develops discussion of the unit in question, right here in the units comments section. TL:DNR- Thanks, his special PW is better than new PW and even better than old PW.

June 11, 2022
Gen_Leo
The trait is not really that different. [QUOTE=Old Trait]IT'S GOING TO GET A LITTLE LOUD: Opposing characters within 6 squares can't use Super Senses. Opposing characters within 6 squares can't use Impervious, Invincible, or Invulnerability but can use Toughness instead. When Banshee hits a character that can't use a power due to this trait, increase damage dealt to that character by 1.[/QUOTE] Both stop Super Senses within 6. Both effectively cap damage reduction at 1. He does lose the bonus damage. His special Pulse Wave is better. [QUOTE=Old Attack Power]SONIC SCREAM: Banshee can use Pulse Wave. When he does, if you give him a double power action instead he can use Improved Targeting: Ignores Blocking Terrain. When a ranged combat attack resolves, any blocking terrain along its line of fire to the target is destroyed. [/QUOTE] He no longer needs to use a Double Power Action (do they still exist in the rules?) to use the additional Improved Targeting since he does it all the time. When he uses Pulse Wave he deals his printed damage of 3 instead of the normal 1. He does lose the trait protecting him from being damaged by Black Tom Cassidy, but that was such a rare occurrence it doesn't seem like much of a loss.
June 11, 2022
